title: Man made lake
review: Built over a check dam by Maj Tripathi and his men of Garwahl regiment. Nicely maintained by army. Nice picnic spot with paddle boats for a sunny day

title: Average lake
review: Go only if you have to experience boating and you have no where to go.  You have a park, some ducks in lake, pedal boats only, a small size restaurant inside the lake complex, some rabbits that’s it.

title: Nice
review: It's a good place to spend some time .there is well maintained small garden and a small artificial pond.it has bridge on pond with makes a view beautiful.inall nothing much to do.

title: beautiful small man made lake...
review: its a man made lake.. small lake.. beautiful surroundings and well maintained... entry fee is Rs 24 and if you take a boat ride then it costs around Rs96/person... boats are clean and they give clean and good safety jackets.. you can also find rabbits and pigeons in an enclosure next to the lake with a small park.. good place for a nice cozy picnic... you can have food at alaknunda café which is just before the entry of lake...

title: A great point at Lansdowne
review: Bhulla Lake is a popular destination point , we also enjoyed the boating in the tal . Well maintained garden area , a house of so sweet rabbits and white pigeons , hamsters , very well protected and taken care.

title: Small lake, nothing great!
review: If you come to Bhulla tal Lake in Lansdowne with the expectation of finding a natural big lake in the town centre and if you want to relate it to lakes found in many other hill stations across India, you are bound for a huge disappointment,

title: Major attraction in Lansdowne..
review: Like all of Lansdowne, this place is so quiet and green. Gives a great opportunity to just sit, relax and absorb the nature. Not a very big lake but the whole complex is very well maintained and clean. Place for some great photos and an absolute visit in Lansdowne.

title: Waste of time
review: If you really don’t have anything to do then visit Bhulla Tal. I don’t think it’s a lake even, it’s a small water body. The boating charges are exorbitantly high — Rs 130 per person. And the whole area is very concrete and artificial, just like any other children’s park in big cities. There are rabbits and swans here, which may excite kids. Otherwise it’s a waste of time.

title: Must visit
review: This is the only place children can enjoy in Lansdowne trip.  A near by park and  restaurant makes this complete for 2 hrs enjoyment pack. It's a small lake having pedal boating facility. Parking also available there. You can enjoy food nearby  restaurant.  Overall a place to enjoy.

title: clean lake
review: Its a artificial lake, which is well maintained. One can enjoy boating, and swings also available for the kids.

title: Average
review: We were in for a surprise as the lake was closed (it is that way in every Wednesday; we should have checked in advance)! The greenery around is worth the time spent though.

title: Not worth it
review: This lake is not worth visiting at all. When in Lansdowne, it's best to trek rather than spending time in visiting the lake and the church.

title: Peaceful serene place
review: This is man-made lake by army people. Very well maintained, lot of seatings inside. One can find a peaceful place and spend good time reading, relaxing, enjoying with family, friends. A place for all age group. Must visit in Lansdowne.

title: A place for families with children, could be made more attractive
review: Winding up and down hilly paths leads you to this 'tourist attraction' in a town singularly nice for the lack of tourists. As one comes down, a view from the higher paths gives a birds eye view of the oblong lake with boating, a wooden bridge, gardens and some enclosures.

title: A small lake but nothing great
review: You can sit and relax as there is nothing much to see around in Lansdowne . The place is also not well maintained . You can go there and claim you have been there .

title: It's a small pond
review: Bhulla talk is a small pond with decaying water, shivering bridge (I was horrified when I read the bridge had capacity of 10 people and I was standing with 20 others on it), lots of insects and some flowers. But then again Lansdowne is a cantonment area (Garhwal Rifles) and these are the only points for visiting. Entry fee is Rs. 20 per adult. The area has ample parking space. Two enclosures home a few rabbits and piegons. Boating has been closed in this pond. If you don't visit this place you have missed nothing and if you do visit this place, well, get some pictures clicked.

title: Nice place but nothing to do much at this place
review: Nothing to do here in this place. You can come down with the family and relax. Kids garden and boating stops in artificial lake.

title: Okey , small lake amidst forest
review: Okey types . No so very great .Cantonment board takes care of its upkeep. A small restaurant is present side by

title: its average
review: As we trek to this place from our hotel so keeping in mind the way we are following i thought it will be great experience but before we reach this is closed before its actual closing time and what i have seen from outside that lake is also not very clean. But there is small restaurant near it Kalandunga may be not writing correct spelling but if you seat here instead of going that lake you will have clear view of lake and you can enjoy the Tea and Maggie which he cooks very tasty.

title: Nice but boring
review: Man-made lake by the Indian Army.. good effort.. but man- made it is.. nothing much to see.. landscaped gardening etc etc

title: One time visit !
review: One of the check points / sight seeing points in Lansdowne area , can go for sometime for a booking. Not a very huge lake but small ones. Okay if kids along.

title: A good green peaceful place for some relaxing time
review: Bhulla taal lake is a beautiful lake with ducks, swans and fishes inside. It is peaceful, calm and surrounded by greenery.

title: Family visit to Lansdowne
review: Very beautiful place when we visited little rain is also going which make this place more beautiful you have to visit that place if you are in Lansdowne you love to have a coffee there.

title: Don’t waste your time.
review: This is a tiny, nondescript large pond. It isn’t worth a visit and you would be wasting your money buying an entry ticket.

title: Fun with family
review: Beautifully maintained lake with clear water for boating, and ducks around will steal the show. Picturesque background and freshness in the breeze sets everything right.

title: Must visit place
review: setup and maintained by Indian Army, a must visit place in Lansdowne. Home for various flora and fauna along with Rabbits, Pigeons, swans, ducks etc.

title: Very clean man made lake
review: The very beautiful place with well seating arrangements, do visit in summers when boating is open. the boating remains closed during monsoons. the lake is very small but is very beautiful.

title: Nice and beautiful place
review: Visited Bhulla Tal Lake. Nice and beautiful place along with the Nature being at it best in Lansdowne. A small man made lake with options for boating. Overall a very unique experience. Strictly a no go place for people looking out for enjoyment as in big hill stations. Only the nature lovers will enjoy Lansdowne. Visited lovely place.

title: Scenic  beauty for peace lovers.
review: 1. Bullatal Lake, is a man made lake dedicated to Garhwali youth of The Garhwal Rifles (regiment of Indian army) who helped in construction of this lake. Bhulla in local Garhwali language means young brother. It should be noted, Lansdowne is a complete cantonment town (command office of Garhwal Rifles of Indian Army). Whole region, is under strict control of army though not restricted hence peace and safety are maintained to its extreme.

title: Great place
review: Very serene place. We saw the mist covering the lake in the evening and it was beautiful. Spent a good 30 mins just sitting on the benches.

title: Not good for summers
review: I visited this place is may month.

title: Non Availability of Boating
review: We traveled in month of May, which is the peak season, but it was sad to see that there was less water in the lake. Due to this there was no boating available at that time. Will not recommend to tourist to spend time and money to view this point.

title: Skip it!
review: The water level was very low.  All the reviews make it out to be a great place to visit and it was disappointing.

title: Pleasant trip with friend.
review: Went with friend in all 6 adult and 3 kids were excited to be their to have boat ride but unfortunately the river is empty no water at all water crisis their so just go their and sit at park and enjoy the near by restaurant food and ice cream their.

title: Good place
review: Not much to describe except it is closed on Wednesday and we reached the same days there

title: Disappointing view
review: It can be better termed as pond than Lake. On the way to Tip-N-Top this so called Lake will come. It is very small in size but as maintained by Army very neat and clean obviously very well maintained. On the way to Tip n Top one can spend some time.

title: A small man made artificial lake
review: Kids will enjoy. Can do some photography

title: Small and quaint lake in heart of Lansdowne.
review: This is a man made lake situated in the heart of Lansdowne. Very well maintained by Army, neat and clean. We did boating which was quite relaxing. Good for kids to enjoy.

title: Nice park a nice place to take pics
review: It was very foggy when we visisted this place. Boating was closed due to level of water. It was a nice place to take some good pics . Had its own piegon cage. Small park for kids to play in and numerous of seating areas. Worth the trip . Parking is also easy.

title: Good place to be with Kids
review: When we went the lake was not full so the boating was not allowed, but it is beautiful man made lake and must visit for people visiting Lansdowne

title: Activity point for people
review: The lake is natural water body with parks and view around it for people to chill and relax. There is a restaurant and a big walking area around the lake.

title: Calm and peaceful
review: When you are off from traffic and ruckus of metro city,  you love every bit of nature.  And experience of boating with family and small kid  also become memorable . There are plenty of ducks , which is biggest attraction for toddlers

title: Well maintained park with water bed and paddle boats
review: Its about 2-3 kms away from Gandhi Chowk( Central point).

title: A small lake maintained by Army
review: A small lake maintained by Army near Lansdowne market. The entry fees is Rs. 20/Person. It has the boating facility if not closed for maintenance.It has a good iron view point and small iron bridge over lake for photo. Overall it is neat and clean place to hang out.

title: Nice Scenic Beauty
review: It is a good place as it has got nice scenic beauty. One can spend hours here sitting and watching natural beauty, especially in winters. There is also a dedicated canteen here from which you can buy snacks. This canteen also offers breakfast, lunch and dinner to its visitors along with casual snacks. Boat riding is also another attraction for its visitors.

title: Peaceful place but not much to explore
review: This place is very peaceful place because it is leass crowed as comparison to other tourist places . This place is preserved by army cantonment . It is good option to spend a peaceful weekend

title: Nice and peaceful place
review: The lake and the entire surrounding are maintained by the Indian Army which have done a very good job in the upkeep of this place. You can also do boating here but Unfortunately, when we reached the place boating was shut as the water level in the lake had receded.

title: Nice Place
review: It is a good spot for family/couples.

title: A man made Lake
review: Just a small lake. Nothing much here.

title: Not so well maintained. but can be visited once you are in lansdowne
review: The lake is not well maintained, infact the lake is too small. Evening seems pleasant. Not so many food option in the canteen nearby..

title: Boating option
review: Visit there if interested in paddle boating. Kids may enjoy but an adult needs to accompany. Well maintained place but nothing much other than a small cafeteria.

title: Visit
review: Nice place to spend 2 hours with boating n nature.

title: Small and Beautiful
review: This is a small lake but we enjoyed boating here. The prices are reasonable. Views are ohkaY. Can skip if in a Hurry.

title: Small lake with awesome surrounding
review: Well miantained place thx to Indian Army.They have entry fee fo rs 20 each. Boating option for Rs80. Nice place to spend 1-2 hrs. Sit and enjoy.Place has a photo printing booth, which you would love to visit and has genuine rates.Just to pass the time.

title: Very ordinary
review: There isn’t anything amusing about the place. It’s just. Lake amidst the Army Cantonment. There’s a restaurant which has limited food options.

title: Nothing Great about it...
review: This is not actually a lake but more of a pond. The water was still and has turned green. People still enjoyed boating but we kept out of it.

title: Well maintained lake
review: It is a small man-made lake. Worth visiting only if the weather is not sunny. The entry ticket is Rs. 80 per person including boating.

title: Well maintained place for boating
review: Army maintains the place so it is very clean. Nicely, well maintained park with boating for Rs. 80 for adults including entry fee. Even if you don't want to go for boating, it is a nice place to visit.

title: Small lake
review: It's a small man made lake and only lake in Lansdowne. I think it's a good place for locals but not for tourists.

title: Sure everything is ending.. “but not yet”
review: Nice little manmade lake(tal) situated around 1.3 km from the main bazaar..The lake is owned,constructed and maintained by Garhwal rifles jawans...

title: The Lake which losts its sheen!
review: 2008 was the first time when we visited this place! Made and maintained by Indian Army, it had bountiful nature. It gave us a shock when we visited in August 2017. The place was like an Exhibition ground with people in  hundred's queing up for the boating.

title: Nice Lake
review: Nice small Late with boating facility and a beautiful park for children.

title: Lovely spot
review: Awesome place.  U can enjoy with ur family.  Boating is also available at reasonable price. Restaurant is also available

title: Time pass
review: Plca is nice. Just to pass the time. Trek tip in top point from here. Thats fun.

title: Just like any other lake, but well maintained
review: This place is just like any other lake, If you are a boating enthusiast and want to spend some time doing pedal boating, please go for it, else it does not have much to offer. Entry fee is Rs 20 and Boating fee is Rs 80 above the entry fee. This place has a photo printing booth, which you would love to visit and has genuine rates, apart from that, not much to offer or visit here.

title: Ok ok
review: Man made pond, I would call it.. touristy, but was relatively quiet... nothing much to see...

title: Not the best place in Lansdowne
review: A small man-made lake which is closed on Wednesday. It ends before it starts. Though the closing time is mentioned as 5 PM  you will not be allowed to boat after 4 PM. At the ends of lake you can find some very beautiful flowers

title: Small lake, although clean and maintained
review: This lake I must say is very small, almost a pond kind of. Although this is well maintained. For vising this one needs to pay a small entry fee. You can do boating as well. there are few ducks which are also an attraction.

title: Sight seeing point of Lansdowne
review: These is a sight seeing point of Lansdowne wherein you have a lake with boating facilities as well as garden.. a good place to visit with children.. also there are adequate parking facilities in the lake .. good place to spend your evening

title: The tal is nice
review: Small place nothing much to do apart from the boat ride. We enjoyed a lot although. The 15 mins boat ride was sufficiently adequate.

title: Nice place for evening in Lansedown
review: This is a nice place if u like peddle boating. The setting of the lake is very nice. Good place to spend ur evening if u r in Lansdown.

title: A small park and lake with boating
review: A small park and lake with boating facility. A small eatery is outside the lake serving good tasty stuff

title: Neat and well maintained
review: We visited with our kids and spent around an hour. Nice place, boating was safe with geese and ducks around. You could spot some fishes. It was sad to see some people throwing chips empty packs as the place is polythene free. A small well maintained Water body for a quiet hill station

title: Very much average
review: If time permits and you have nothing to do then visit this lake for time pass. Personally i felt that the surroundings have more natural beauty than the lake itself.

title: Beautiful!!!
review: Very peaceful place to visit in Lansdowne. You can enjoy good quality time with friends here doing boating or just simply doing nothing and chilling.

title: Can easily skip
review: Not certainly a must visit place. But since there is nothing much to see and do in Lansdowne we can while away some time here.It is a good place for families with young kids.

title: Small lake
review: It's a small man made lake. Paddle boats are available. 80 rs per head for half an hour. Life jackets are available and compulsory. Water is dirty. Closes by 5pm in winters and 6pm in summers.parking is available and free. Has a small children park. Fast food is available. Washroom are there, free and clean.

title: Dirty Water lake. not worth
review: The lake is  1.5 kms from the main lansdowne market. A walk till the lake is advisable. Enjoy the view.

title: Small lake in a hill station
review: There are very few tourist attractions in Lansdowne and bhulla lake is one of them. Bhulla lake is a small man made lake which is situated around 2 kms away from main market. There is a small restaurant and a small garden also there. Entry ticket is Rs 20 without boating and Rs 80 with boating for half hour. Although i personally feel boat paddles are very hard and one will feel tired in 10 minutes. Water in the lake is a bit dirty.

title: Must visit place in Lansdowne
review: This is man made lake and beautifully managed by Army. I went along with spouse n 3 yrs old daughter. We all liked the place.

title: Beautiful lake in the middle of the town
review: This is a bful lake with boating and bful view from there. This is one of the tourist attraction @ Lansdowne and I must say a must visit place for tourists who like to get good clicks with lake.

title: Blissful moments
review: Small lake maintained by cantt board is beautiful indeed.stroll with greenery around, peddle boat..Enjoy a cup of coffee..

title: Boating place for couples
review: a normal lake with boating facility. a nice place to spend sometime. mostly you will find couples here. charges when we visited in August 2017 was 80 INR per person for boating and 20 INR per person for entry.

title: Good place for a family evening..
review: Getting with family and enjoying the evening is at Bhulla Lake.. Spend some quality time and have fun..

title: poorly managed and most dirty lake
review: this lake is surely in a very sorry state. it is a place where tourist go for boat ride but the water is so dirty that i am sure if anyone takes a fall, will surely suffer from skin disease. the approach road is narrow and roads are not maintained.

title: Nice place to visit with kids
review: A man-made Lake, maintained beautifully by Garwal Rifles. With a visit for spending an evening with kids.

title: Couple visit
review: Good, serene, beautiful,calm place.Must go if you are visiting Lansdowne.You would love to see the birds chirping, the greenery around, the kids playing, the fogs around.

title: Bag Packers trip
review: Superb place.. A small lake with mesmerising view.. Can do boating and enjoy nature... Great place for families and couples.. Selfies

title: Small pond
review: Don't go with the expectation of a lake! Otherwise its a good place for kids to play and do boating.

title: Good fun
review: Attraction of city and worth going though lake is small but it's a good place to hang out nice weather and food near by.

title: Neat and Clean
review: This sight is managed by indian army guys, hence it's quite clean and well managed. It's a small lake (or you can call it a big pond), where you can also do boating.

title: It was a bit underwhelming but boating with family is always fun!
review: It was a bit underwhelming but boating with family is always fun! Dont miss out on the mugs where you can imprint your photo with the pond in the background.

title: Man made lake
review: In the army town of Lansdowne there's nothing much to do but relax and go for treks. This place attracted very few visitors due to which the government made a man made lake called Bhulla tal. It has boating like every other lake in Nainital district. The lone cafe here is very good. One of the best coldcoffee I've had. This area is maintained by the army and one can see cadets cleaning the area post 5pm. It's a nice place to visit.

title: nice lake
review: lake is very nice and clean... very good location and our experiance was good .. lake is naintained by cantt lansdiwne

title: Shop at the AWWA shop later
review: the outing is more for the sights and sounds than the lake it self ...which ,being man made, is nothing much to write home about, but the weather even in the peak of summer is quite pleasant, so a lil trip up and down this scenic place is worth giving a go

title: small yet peaceful
review: It was a really small yet peaceful lake. I saw many people boating and relaxing themselves in the garden above.

title: nice place in lansdowne
review: nice place to spend time... you can do boating, walk in garden... a small restaurant is also there....,

title: Nice view
review: The view around the lake is quite good. Fun place for children. You can do boating there. Overall nice place with a touch of nature

title: Calm and peaceful
review: Bhulla Tal is a very small lake in Lansdowne. Yes, actually a very small lake, a pond sort off. However, it is a sort of place which defines the spirit of Lansdowne - peaceful, serene, pure bliss. When we reached this place, it was raining, which further added to thew green beauty of this place.

title: Nice location
review: Good and nice location to visit...I visited here on Wednesday. It remains closed on this day so can't tell more

title: Nice relaxing spot
review: One of the few attractions in Lansdowne, it has a nice little park with a lake for a quick visit, you can also go for boating here.

title: Bhulla lake
review: Nothing much to look forward to except the drive off course. Otherwise well maintained lake with peddle boating all managed maintained by garwhal regiment

title: Smaller than swimpool at  5 star hotel
review: The lake is more of a pond. it really small. The only attraction is small ducks with whom you can play for  some time.

title: nice picnic spot only
review: lansdowne doesnt have many places to see....this is one of those few

title: Must visit point
review: This is certainly must visit point in the town specially if you are going with children. Please note that this place remains closed during Wednesday as most of others places also. It has got a lake with boating facilities and a good garden

title: Must visit with family
review: If you're traveling with family and k8ds/teenagers, tHis is probably a must to visit place in lansdowne. With a few places to take pictures at, this place offers a man made lake with boating facility and a small restaurant with somewhat decent menu. A place yiu can spend about 2 hours at.

title: Dont go boating here
review: The lake doesnt have much to offer, so boating here is not  worth it unless of course you're are a boating enthusiast and it does not matter to you how mucky the water is or that the lake ends before it actually begins :)

title: In the midst of wonderful Natural beauty: A man made lake.
review: Interesting artificial lake for safe  recreational purposes but however,  with so much natural beauty would you settle for something man made? Perhaps it serves those who live in the surrounding areas and are no more overwhelmed with the scenic sights that enthrall  visitors.

title: Lovely little lake
review: Maintained well and there is ample space to sit back and relax. Boating ride was good except for the fact that the lake or tal was too small for 15 minutes for boat ride. Charges are 80 INR per person. Children below 5 years are not charged. The boats are in good condition and life jackets are also provided.

title: Lake of view
review: This lake is very small but very charming,one can enjoy the view with boat a very handsome experience.

title: Peaceful place
review: Lovely place, well maintained, clean with amazing view surrounded by mountains....perfect for boat riding, spending time calmly...

title: Lovely place !
review: Very beautiful place. A small lake having lots of ducks. Very well managed by the Army. Also pretty cheap Boating, only 80/- for 15 mins including entry fee that is 20/-, so effectively costs just 60 bucks. Enjoyed every moment here. The restaurant was great too and again great prices. Highly recommended !

title: Recommended for family groups
review: USP is boating at the lake. It is amongst the top 3 things to do when in Lansdowne. The area is well developed and there is a separate area for swings and play zone for children. I feel it is safe for kids but you would need to supervise the kids in any case, coz they are kids, after all.

title: Tranquil lake
review: Good for a one time visit. Since adults can enjoy the serenity and woods of Lansdowne by walking and strolling in nature, children are left out with not much of options in Lansdowne unless they are nature lover. Hence a visit to Bhulla Tal Lake is a quick energiser for the young ones. Small rides, swing and jungle-gym may attract them at the lake premises. Also rabbits and guinea pigs are major attraction for children along with paddle boats inside the lake. After a stroll around the lake enjoy a cup of hot coffee on a cold day or a Vadilal icecream on a hot day just outside the lake.

title: Small nice and clean picnic spot
review: As the options of places to visit in Lansdowne are limited, this is a place one will surely visit. The lake is very small but the park is clean and well maintained. There is boating facility too which is for abt ₹120/person. There is a canteen which provides good food.

title: Must visit place
review: One of the best place in Lansdowne... You might experience cold and rain.. So carry your umbrella and light jacket..

title: Must visit
review: Must visit place , good to experience paddle boating

title: Not worth spending much time!!
review: A very small man made lake. Boating is available at the lake but not refreshing.

title: Picnik spot
review: If you are looking for how to spend your time while in Lansdowne then you may vidit here. It's sort of a picnik spot with pedal boats available in the lake and some swings for the kids.

title: nice place to visit
review: nice place to visit, one can do paddle boating..cost is like 80 rs for an adult and 20 rs entry fee into the garden, cantonment area, garden is very beautiful

title: Nothing to see
review: Total waste of time of not visiting in monsoon. Just few rabbits and birds, where kids can hv fun. Otherwise, nothing great

title: Great efforts
review: This is an artificial lake, maintained by Garhwal Rifles. You can enjoy boating in the lake and watch the lovely ducks. The entire premises is clean and well taken care of. Everything is refurbished or renovated from junk, which creates no environmental waste. (Lansdowne is a plastic free zone and littering attracts penalty). Commendable efforts by the Army.

title: just small pond of water
review: Just small pond of water, boating experience is good, its look like a artificial lake made my local bodies .

title: A Small Lake Run by Army
review: Bhulla Tal is the Small Lake Run by Army. You need to pay 580 bucks for Boating (15Mins) inside the Lake. it's a Small place to Sit and Relax.

title: Neat, Quiet & Scenic!!
review: It's the major attraction point of Lansdowne. Good place to spend quality time during  morning and evening. Activities which are available are boating, children park for kids and a small hut where they have birds, rabbits  and pet mice, fish feeding. It's well kept place and you can click some nice pictures. Since it's not spread too much you won't feel tired.

title: Small Lake with boating facilities
review: It's much like a small pond than a lake. But you can sit in a nearby place on hills and watch people and birds go about. A small restaurant serves reasonable quality food with good variety.

title: Boating in a small lake !!!
review: Bhulla tal lake is a small pond with boating facilities. it wants to do time pass over there and wanna relax you can visit there. but its not a must place to visit.

title: Not worth it
review: Very small lake. Rather a pond. Nothing much to see. Went all the way to the lake but did not enter since it was visible from outside. Water level was low in April.

title: Not just a lake, a complete picnic spot!
review: An absolutely wonderful place for boating as well as picnic. It has got lot of swings for kids. One of the most beautiful and happening areas in the Lansdowne.

title: Clean
review: The lake looked a bit artificial. Though the seating arrangement around the lake was really nice and also had a nearby restaurant. Lake opens after 9:30 in the morning.

title: Best place in Lansdowne
review: Nice place, clean, cold, lots of picture opportunities, free parking! Did not do boating as lake is small. Went around for selfies

title: Man made spot
review: Nice for family time, small lake for boating. There was snow fall when we visited, which add much more fun.

title: Nice place for a small visit with the family
review: This place is majorly planned for families. You can do boating which is Rs 80 including entry fee which is Rs 20. Kids can see some animals which were kept in cages. Average park with some additional features.

title: Nice
review: Tourist spot of the area. It closes by 5pm, so reach on time to enjoy the boat ride for 15-20mins There are rabbits so kids enjoy them. Restaurant serves good snack and food items, worth eating there very reasonably priced. There are short cuts from-to tip-n-top from the lake. Enjoy the track.

title: good Mantina lake
review: Bhulla lake is well maintaince by Ghawal Regmt give 5 star for there management to maintaine the lake in quite good maner

title: Small man made lake.
review: A small man made lake maintained by the Army. Has entrance fee for each person above 42 inches. There is well maintained lawn with rabbits for kids to play with. One can chose to enjoy some paddle boating as well.

title: Nothing great
review: This an artificial lake. The access to the lake from behind the church is a long one but really good for nature lovers. However the distance is not mentioned. It is quite a good distance for anybody attempting it. It is easily accessible by a car from another route.

title: useless place
review: This is a man made lake with the the water is muddy , your local lake will be much better than this one do not waste your hard earned money

title: Nothing great to see!
review: A very small lake with a minimal amount of water.

title: For the lazy evening of Lansdowne
review: Just like Lansdowne, it is a slow, giving nothing exceptional to give lake. Come here after stroll on mall for spending lazy time as there is nobody to disturb you. You can buy reasonably priced eatables from attached canteen. Have a book and enjoy your mine time.

title: Perfect place to enjoy with family
review: It is small park having a man made lake, with provision of boating in it. Restaurant offers good food. There is a Art & Craft shop in the same premises operated by Army, Great & very reasonable prices

title: Lake in Hill
review: we reached there at 4:45 pm and were not allowed to get in as the closing time is 5pm, however the place was really awesome

title: Soothing Experience
review: Traveling to lansdowne is itself a clam and soothing experience and Bhulla Tal lake makes the experience more refreshing. Although Bhulla Tal Lake is a small lake maintained by Gorkha Regiment but it offers a lot like paddle boating, light tracking and a green lush environment. It is best for end of day activity for relaxing for your body. A restaurant is also there at the lake.

title: Themed Park
review: Its a pond not lake maintained by Army.

title: Refreshing Place
review: It's a refreshing place. take selfies, pictures with nature...and of course boating...we sent 3 hours there....snaks are tasty

title: The mandatory Tal
review: first things first, don't expect a Sattal or Bhimtal like size for a lake. This is reasonably small. you can do few rounds of paddle boating. The ducks and geese will swim around and that for most is a good attraction. the water of the lake isn't the cleanest, but that is expected in most areas.

title: Tiny, God for Kids
review: This lake is a tiny lake and good for Kids with boating and scenic surroundings. As it is within the cluster of visiting points, its Ok to visit.

title: Man-made waterbody
review: This is not a natural lake, but a man-made one, hence you can strike out the differences easily. The place was kind of autumnal worn out and not lush green this February, and the water was very murky and dirty.

title: Its a pond not lake!
review: First time we visited Lansdowne and everyone we asked this one place to visit and we thought it must be something good. But actually, it is a small artificial pond and not a lake maintained by Army people.

title: Bhulla Taal Boat Ride
review: Excellent experience boat ride at bhulla Tall, my kid just simply loved it. Great view & totally different experience. Must if you are visiting Lansdowne.

title: Good place to spend with family
review: It is a good place to walk around and spend time with family. In Lansdowne there are very few places to visit, here one can do boating, and walk around in the garden. Also, there are many rabbits in the park which makes it a fun place. Besides, restaurant in the lake area also serves good delicious bearfast as well as lunch items at reasonable price.

title: garden amongst the clouds
review: A well-maintained garden with beautiful landscaping and scent of freshness, if you are lucky then you will get to be amongst the descending clouds, all in the midst of a beautiful lake

title: Small packet big dhamaka
review: Although this lake is not very big in size but has all the things to attract tourists. This is very much clean and maintained. Thanks to our Army for that. Salute to Indian Army. Jai Hind...........

title: Small lake with boating facility
review: This is a small lake with a few boating facilities, obviously nothing compared to Naini tal, sattal or bhim tal. but neat and clean nevertheless.

title: Good man made object
review: One of the most amazing attractions of Lansdowne is this lake. Man made not natural, however good..not to deep also

title: Well maintained and good place to hangout with friends and family.
review: Bhulla lake is very well maintained with clean water, boating facility and nominal entry fees.

title: Okay but crowdy
review: One time visit us fine, boating facility available. Good for children, ample space for parking. Suggest for a brief walk

title: There are bigger ponds than this lake
review: Just because this place is one of the top rated places in Lansdowne does not really make it that great. It is just a little water body with a provision of boating in dirty water.

title: Nice Laje Boating available
review: Boating lovers, Its the place for you. Always Foggy and sometimes you can enjoy the clouds touching your face

title: Must for kids
review: Well maintained small lake by Garwal rifle trainees note it's closed every Wednesday.

title: January 2017 Visit
review: Quite Enjoyable Experience. An artificial lake with Boating facility, green areas,a mini zoo having Rabbits and pigeons are an attraction for Kids. Good Picnic Spot.

title: Good
review: Nice place to visit .Small lake but well maintained .children will enjoy the beauty of lake.Boating fascility available ,

title: Lansdowne
review: Nice place to relax. Small cascades falling into the lake. Paddle boats. Maintained by the army. Hence neat and clean. Good all found eatery to quench your thirst or satiate your hunger. The best tourist attraction on Lansdowne.

title: A small lake in Lansdowne
review: This lake is one of the very few tourist spots in Lansdowne. It is very small, within the cantonment area and is therefore nicely maintained. It has a boating facility for the visitors. Overall, it cannot be termed as a major attraction.

title: A Picnic Spot
review: That's exactly what Bhulla Tal was. A small lake with paddle boats, a garden and a stream. Nice place to sit and relax since there isn't much to do in Lansdowne. Quite popular with the young crowd.

title: Good place to chill with family & friends
review: It is one of the attractions of Lansdown, surrounded in greenery. You can enter & relax on the benches here or go for boarting with your loved ones. The experience was nice.

title: don't bother to visit
review: A small artificial lake with boating facility within the limits of the town.  But not worth the visit unless you have ample time and nothing else to do

title: Nice place to spend time
review: A beautiful and nice place to spent some time with your family/friends or spouse. One can do boating for around 15-20 minutes at the coast of Rs 80/person. One can see beautiful ducks swimming along with your boat A very peaceful and must visit place at Lansdowne.

title: Excellent place for a calm outing with your kids
review: Very calm and peaceful place to spend time with your family. The lake can serve you with option for boating in small groups and one can also take a stroll in the nearby gardens and see Rabits, Swans etc. The lake also has a kids play area with free rides like swing, see-saw, slides etc. The only restaurant in the Bhulla lake serves decent food with options to choose from, Chinese, Italian and Indian dishes. It was good fun.

title: Must go
review: Army created it and maintaining it. Have boating facility. Costing 80 per head. Canteen is great , cost effective and good taste. Try paneer dosa.

title: ok!
review: a small lake at a great hill station. but the natural beauty gets destroyed due to too much decoration for tourists attraction

title: Small but well maintained lake
review: This is the main tourist destination in lansdowne. Its a very small lake maintained by the Army and has some landscaping all around the boundary. Because its the main attraction, make sure to visit this early mornng. By noon this place gets overcrowded and you often dont find parking. There is also a small restaurant and some swings at the entrance for this lake. A good spot if you want to just sit back and relax.

title: Good For kids
review: Well Maintained place .Mainly for kids to Enjoy Boating,Swings and Having Maggie outside the Place at only one Cafe at the place.

title: Great afternoon
review: Great place to spend time. Scenary around is beautiful. It may be a bit crowded but still i rate this place highly.

title: Place to hangout
review: Bhulla tal lake is maintained and beautiful. They charge entry fee to visit has good parking space.if one wishes boating is available. It is good for kids also as it has playing space and some pet animals for their interest.

title: fun 2 hangaround
review: the boating experience was good.there is a nice tea stall which has gr8 coffee to offer especially in the cold wether

title: Hardly a lake
review: This was not really a lake as compared to so many others seen in Uttarakhand. Somewhat of a let-down.

title: Bad place, don't waste time
review: It's a bad place.not worth visiting. There's nothing but 5 ducks who have been forced to sit in an artificial pond which gets its water from the gutter.plz don't go.

title: An hour to spend
review: though Lansdowne do not have many tourist spot ,this  one serves the purpose of spending an hour or  two  -the management is under the  control of Army and thus clean and well organised

title: Good lake
review: A small & but clean lake , we enjoyed boating here. The rabbit were one of the attraction for my small daughter.

title: lovely
review: its a lovely artifical lake, offering paddle boating on the lake. you can get your photo taken and printed on a mug as souvenir. the ducks and geese on the lake and the rabbits on the way down are adorable.

title: Nice Scenic Place to visit in town
review: Nice place having small lake with boating,machan(tree house )& garden area with rides for kids..

title: A local attraction for small time pass
review: Boating never appeals me and this one is a very small affair, as the lake is very small. Children might find it attractive. The area surrounding the taal has been made a bit touristy, but otherwise it is more of an attraction for the locals.

title: Poorly Maintained Tourist Spot
review: As the name says, it is a Lake. But not much of a lake. This lake is a man-made artificial body maintained by Indian army. We visited the place during monsoon. And it was lunch time I guess because the boating was shut for some odd reason.There are animals rabbits and birds kept in cage to attract the tourist. But somehow it fails to attract me. Plus, the only spot I like was walking over the bridge. It was raining yet we took a stroll of the entire place and nothing exciting.

title: Nice and rainy visit
review: Lake is good and has some ducks though small, boating is available at 80 rs. per person. Place was nice and had a restaurant as well. Few rabbits, play area with swings and lake-over bridge is also good. Its the only fun place which we liked most in lansdowne

title: Scenic
review: Visited on a warm sunny day, towards the end of June and spent a couple of hours. The lake has boating facilities which we enjoyed a lot. The park surrounding the lake is very beautifully maintained having lots of exquisite flowers and plants with nice sitting arrangements. There is also a nice restaurant outside the lake area.

title: Boating
review: A silent place in the already silent Lansdowne. Only 1 5 minutes drive from where we stayed. Boating is available, recreational activities for children and a small restaurant all tucked in the same place.

title: Another excellent waste of time
review: This is a small park with water around it, that too must have been arranged. The work Lake should be removed with immediate effect from it, another waste of time at Lansdownde.

title: Nicely Mainlined Lake
review: This lake is well maintained since it's been taken care by Army. it's easily accessible from lansdowne market. You can enjoy the boat ride or can just enjoy the beauty of the park by paying for the entry ticket.

title: Small lake and not much to see!
review: Went to this place during my recent family trip. Not much to see though and the eatery also needs more seating place and more items on its menu.

title: Nice artifical lake
review: Lake is small but surroundings are well maintained. It's managed by army. There is boating but we didn't go for it as it was raining. u can get ur photos clicked and printed on a mug for memories. Restaurant is average.

title: Average place
review: It was an average place with limited food option. The only good part I came here via walking path from tip n top and the view was very good.

title: Bhulla Tal
review: Nice place to spend your time n holiday with your family. By chance we got misty weather, which gave us very pleasant time to spend.

title: Nice Small Man Made Lake
review: The one tourist spot in Lansdowne. A small lake near the city center which ducks and rabbits roaming about. The best thing about Lansdowne being there aren't too many people about except on long weekends.

title: Small and Beautiful Man Made
review: We liked the place, it has big lawns , small children parks having rabbits and green meadows. Must bvisit place in Lansdowne.

title: Lansdowne trip
review: Go and take some biscuits to feed the ducks and if the weather is good just sit there for some time.

title: OK Type Place
review: Its a OK type of place, since Lansdown has only limited options to explore you can give a try..

title: Small and serene
review: Bhulla tal is a small lake where paddle boats are available for hire. A round of the lake is pleasant. It is not commercialised at all. Enjoyed the outing with ducks and swans also joining in.

title: My Lansdowne visit
review: This is one of the best place in Lansdowne to visit. The Bhulataal is made by the local army persons and is nicely cared by them. The rabbit park there is a nice time pass for the kids and boating there will leave some good memories in mind.

title: Quite little place, very well maintained and managed by the Army
review: One of the very few things to do in Lansdowne- good place if you are with kids. You can enjoy boating (pedal boats), get your pic printed on a mug (at dirt cheap prices, 150 bucks per mug!), sit and chillax, or let the kids play in the swings area outside the lake area. You can also shop very reasonable stuff from the Nidhi shop there, which is run by Army Wives welfare association. A small restaurant is there too- which again has some yummy eating options at very reasonable rates. Good place to spend some time and enjoy!

title: Worth a visit
review: Since Lansdowne is a small town with not much options to visit , the market has also very limited exotic stuff for tourists.. Hence this lake point is something worth going to..you enjoy the hilly ghat road up.. Then feeding the ducks in the pond.. Some regular hill station mall road type activities to look forward to in an otherwise very quite place Lansdowne

title: Best place to spend time with your loved ones
review: Bhulla Tal is man made and maintained by army. It has boating facility available. A children park with swings and restaurant. Lovely little lake, surrounded by beautiful gardens.

title: Decent clean manmade lake
review: Bhulla tal is a manmade lake. I was taken aback at the small size of it. They offer boating in the lake which is average in itself. But having ducks swimming around you while boating was the main attraction. The area is very clean and well maintained. At times, we were wondering if we are in India itself :P

title: Not much to do, small lake built by the Garhwal soldiers, closed on Wednesdays
review: A little away from the small market place of Lansdowne, so you will have to drive all the way to it, walking will be tiring. You can do boating there, has a small eating place too, children can enjoy the swings that have been put up there.

title: Small but Beautiful
review: This is probably the best attraction of Lansdowne. Everyone visits it as it's one of the most popular tourist attraction in Lansdowne. Ideal for families with kids.

title: Awesome day
review: This place can be considered a good public attraction.

title: Time pass for Family
review: This pplace is a good time pass for the entire family. There are boats, ducks, rabits, restaurants, one Army shop having good apparels.Must see

title: Enjoy a picnic with kids
review: Good place to enjoy an hour or two with kids. The lake is well maintained, you can enjoy boating & spend some time in the park around.

title: Just a pond
review: Bhulla Tal is just one of 2-3 places one can visit in Lansdowne. Our actually a small Pon maintained by the Army. Has only 5-6 pedal boats. You can go there and just feel bad. It's dirty and the caretaker told us it houses water snakes as well. Though Army takes enough safety precautions and no one is allowed to ride boats without life vest.

title: Not worth my tiime
review: Imagine a small lake and a long que as there is nothing else one can do in Lansdown so everyone forced to do this. But the effort and the results only interest small kids.

title: Small Lake
review: This is most crowded as you can boat here. Its most popular and crowded place here. Garden surrounding this very small lake is quite nice to sit.

title: Well maintained and nice place !
review: The army also maintains the beautiful Bhulla Tal Lake over here ! Very well organised and maintained , this place has a man made lake / artificial lake along with great efforts done to preserve the environment ! Saw a flock of ducks , pure white in the lake along with rabbits , Guinea pigs and birds in a cage too ! Also there was boating on the lake ! There was sufficient parking for the visitors over there ! The bridge added on to the mystic beauty of the lake and there were good amount of seating areas in some gaps for everyone ! A small canteen was located outside the premises of the lake which served tea , coffee and snacks for the visitors !

title: Nice place.
review: Nice place to have fun.Beautiful gardens and boating ride is good.nice experience with family.

title: Beauty
review: Beautiful lake. A huge park on the hills with the lake situated in the center. People who like boating will love this place and other will simply love the way it is constructed.

title: small but nice lake
review: this is a very small but nice lake, on the way to tippin top .u can enjoy boat ride at just 50 bucks along with sumptous chat pakori

title: Worth visiting if you are in Lansdowne
review: Look , you don't have much things to do in Lansdowne. So visiting this place became mandatory if you are in this calm and serene hill station. It's a man made lake by the army. Pretty well maintained so far.

title: Good place to spend your time
review: Nice & well maintained park. Decent lake for boating. They have rabbits & ducks and kids enjoy here.

title: Too much hyped
review: Oh God it must have been a beautiful place with perfect scenic beauty but kind of commercialised beyond the limit. one has to wait for 45 minutes for Boating , hence we chose not to boat , we simply took tickets and sat on grass for an hour or so.

title: Though small but good place
review: This place is in Lansdowne cantonment and basically meant for family of army personnel who live there. Tourists are also allowed. There is a small lake where you can do paddle boating till 6.30 pm. Though uncomfortable but you need to wear life jacket. For defense personnel the boating rate is Rs. 40 for others it's Rs. 80. Entry fee is Rs 30 if you don't go for boating. The are number of jhoolas for kids, a small area for birds, rabbits, pigeons etc. Kids will definitely love this place. The place is surrounded with colorful flowers all around. There is a restaurant too.

title: Lovly place.
review: A lovely spot to visit at Lansdowne.Not very far from main market.Small lake with padel boats.sorunded by a well maintained garden.very neat n clean park.As it is maintained by the army.one can enjoy shopping also at AWWA gift shop there.A good restaurant is also there.

title: Beautiful
review: Lovely place,  a must visit point of lansdowne. Boting in optional and garden around lake is awesome.

title: Bhulla Lake
review: Extra care was taken by Providing Life Safing Jacket during Boating.Army personal was there to Monitor each & every Boat.

title: Good family place to hangout with boating
review: Place contains gardens, mini zoo, boating. The good part is lake have lots of ducks, so while boating your boat goes near them.

title: Just pass time place
review: Just a pass time place to visit for 1 or 2 hrs. Needs a good fast food restaurant at this place. Current food facilities are not up to the mark

title: The only happening place in Lansdowne!
review: A must visit if you go to Lansdowne, pretty lake with boating and animal viewing facilities, good food options, nice views.

title: Boating fun
review: Boating fun time, water was less but boating is always fun.

title: Bhulla Lake
review: Neat and clean place with a good view of Nature with small fun activities for Children. You can enjoy boating in the lake. Size of lake is bit small.

title: Not a Lake
review: Disappointed to see the lake. Very less water , that too not clean. Entrance ( INR 20 /PP)& Boating ( INR 80/PP) tickets are higher than value for money, Would recommend to shop at Shop at " Nidhi ", a reasonable price shop outside the lake . You can get " Landsdowne" t-Shirt from this shop as memory.

title: Weekend tripping
review: A cool and nice place but because of lack of water in the lake boating was closed but still u can enjoy the surrounding....apart frm this there are lot of other places to see

title: Bhullatal Lake is a must visit for boating enthusiasts
review: Bhullatal Lake is really good visit for typical family type outing. You feel refreshed and relaxed there. There are another small places to visit in lansdown like St. Mary's Church, Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple etc. Bhullatal lake is for all kind of age groupes.

title: Just a small artificial lake
review: Just a small lake for boating and a small park maintained by army (you have to purchase tickets for entry and boating separately), can be avoided but considering very few attractions in Lansdowne most of the people visit this place.

title: Extremely refreshing
review: A beautiful small army-made lake couple of miles from the core lansdowne is a must visit - not just for kids but all age group will enjoy. The restaurant out there serves delicious food. The tourist shop, Nidhi has some kool stuff to pick up - I bought very nice fabric 'Lansdowne 5700 ft' t-shirts for myself and my son.

title: Nice Place with Boating
review: A must visit place for boating lovers, this place has ducks and rabbits as well, a bridge over the lake on which you can walk and go to other side of lake and sit there on benches. Though a small lake, but good one.

title: Good place for kids.
review: The lake is small with boating and worth to visit for 1-2 hours as there are no options in Lansdowne.

title: Good place!
review: Awesome view but a little over hyped...the lake is artificial and not clean...but the boating was okay...little overpriced as compared to the timing they gave...ppl were not interested there to engage tourists..a little let down for the place...

title: Nice place to hang out in lansdowne
review: One of the tourist spots in lansdowne. Boating in the lake is enjoyable. Nice restaurant with good choice of food.

title: Nice Place
review: There is a small lake amidst a well maintained park. Paddle boats are available but with a long waiting queue. Nothing much to do.

title: Nice place
review: Lake is man made with a entry fee attached to it, nice place for short walks, had to wait bit for the paddle boat.

title: Lovely
review: It's beautiful ,clean . surrounded by beautiful gardens .garden has a mini zoo having rabbits and pigeons.

title: lake with nice views
review: usual lake with all the usual views. Can go there for relaxation & peace. Not a big lake , but boating facilities are available

title: picnic spot
review: About 2 km from gandhi chowk. A good walking experience through green forest and clean environment. One can spent 3-4 hour at the lake. May have some snacks or some ordinary kind of food stuff.

title: Ok types
review: Nothing much to see, can be skipped ciz the lake is actully too small to be called a lake and lack of maintenance as well.

title: Lake with boating
review: Lake and boating is nice.

title: small artificial lake
review: Bhulla Lake the engineering marvel artificial lake was closed after enquiring the locals told that it‘d open around 9 AM (but later we found out that it was closed till today, because after fire incident 3 days back cleaning is being done).

title: Small and putrid lake
review: There is boating. Go if you have kids, if you are an adult group, take a walk along the roads of Lansdowne and walk to the villages. This place is a nicely decorated place good for picnics. Who visits Lansdowne for picnics?

title: A place kids would like
review: A simple lake with boats, flowers and rabbits that would attract children. The place is quite clean but has very less water currently

title: Artificial Lake 300 m long
review: Not a very attractive place but since Lansdowne has very few places so this will be good place to spend 2 hrs.

title: Nice picnic spot
review: Good for spending some time in cool mountain breeze. Boating not very appealing. Food at adjacent joint is ok. Spot has potential for greater tourist attraction with better facilities.

title: Small artificial lake
review: Small artificial lake with boating facility. Kids would enjoy the ducks, rabbits and white pigeons. Nothing much to do there. Can spend around 2 hr there.

title: An okay place to be
review: Since there isn't much around to do in Lansdowne, Bhulla Tal is an okay place to spend an hour. It is a man made lake with not so clear water, some ducks and boating facility.

title: Dont Bhulo this Bhulla taal
review: By itself this lake will not appeal many but if told that this is man made and an attempt to conserve the nature then a second thought enters the mind. It is maintained by the army and is spic and clean. One can also enjoy paddle boating. It has also an arch footover bridge covering the width of the lake.

title: Average
review: A very small lakes but with good arrangements for paddle boats to entertain kids with reasonable prices & neat surroundings.Visit if u have kids together otherwise no point ,just a wastage of time.

title: Nice lake with boating facility
review: Very clean and small lake with boating facility. Good place to eat around and  kids play area too. must visit for family travelers.

title: Good place
review: This place is a good to visit. Not a wonderful lake. All our family members enjoy lake view and boating.

title: Nice lake
review: Our son had gone to Nainital with friends, so it was just my husband and I. We did not use the boating facility as the water appeared green and dirty. We had not had breakfast, so went to the cafe, Surprisingly, the dosa was good, but in the papdi chat they had used ketchup instead of tamarind chutney, so was too tangy for my taste. As usual, my phone had to be charged, which the waiter did. My ticket details were on the phone, so had to be conserved. There was a rowdy group of young girls and boys at the next table. Had probably biked from Delhi, it appeared. On the other side, there was a family spanning three generations. We bought a bottle of water - nice and cold. I also saw another shop selling sarees and suits - but nothing local. On the whole, quite a nice place, but not unique.

title: Small pond
review: Nothing great, a small pond without any water looks nothing .. green, static, not clean little water couldn't excite me to buy tickets & get in

title: Nice place
review: It was a place to enjoy boating and the cool breeze. good place to click pictures too. worth a visit

title: Well maintained area overall (except the pond itself)
review: Quick Facts:

title: Artificial lake
review: A small lake with boating facilities and a nice eatery. The bridge spanning the lake is a nice place to take pictures.

title: Nice Small Army Made Lake
review: Its a very small lake,Made and maintained by Indian Army.Its not very far from Gandhi Chowk(main centre of Lansdowne).I have been there just couple of days back.You can hire a taxi or if u have ample time can walk till that place.15-20 mins walk from Gandhi Chowk.I would say its a decent place and kind of OK for baiting.Nothing much to see there.Just can spend sometime there with your friends and family.Though I would be say they charge 80 rupees for boating(which is bit on the higher side) which includes entry fee of 20 rupees and only 20 rupees for entry which I feel should be made fee to public.The Lake is not that clean and views are also kind of OK.overall you can spend 30-45 mins there and not beyond that.But if u have ample time then you can just sit on the benches alongside the lake and relax.

title: Not much of a place to visit
review: Its a very small lake,Made and maintained by Indian Army.Its not very far from Gandhi Chowk(main centre of Lansdowne).. not much a place to visit. need to wait form your turn to boat in small lake.

title: Simple and calm
review: Although its a man made lake but there is noting artificial about this place.

title: A tranquil spot in a peaceful oasis
review: Kudos to the Garhwali Rifles Regiment Centre in Lansdowne to have created a "tourism hot-spot" in their tiny Hill station...

title: Nice Place for Kids
review: its a great place where we can do boating, kids can play in the park and elders can enjoy the view .

title: Nice lil lake
review: This is a nice little lake, but we had an awesome time here because there are so many rabbits and birds playing in the green parks, with which you can go and play, and they'll let you play! It was so much fun for my 2 year old. There are eating options also available with decent food.

title: Well managed Lake
review: You can reach Bhulla Taal by trekking from Tip n Top or from main market.

title: Nice place for family hangout
review: Nicely maintained man made lake with boat ride option. Recommended for hangout in the evening hours but ensure to reach there before sun set as it closes down before sun set. Not many options to have food near by. Only couple of shops serving limited options.

title: a small & sweet lake
review: this is a very small & sweet lake with a few boats....

title: Boating is a nice experience
review: In bhulla tal, the only thing good is boating. There is nothing much to do apart from that. There is a small garden which is well maintained

title: Not good as per exception
review: small lake , boating is costly according to services and lake,

title: ANother tourist attraction
review: Nothing extraordinary. Its a man made reservoir. But the way it is maintained by GRRC and the cleanliness is commendable. Can spend about an hour

title: Nice
review: Beautiful lake. And some rabbits are also kept in an enclosure there. Nothing much is to be seen. There are some ducks too and a small children's park.

title: Not so good place
review: Lake is so small ,boating dose'nt seem to be fun here so its not so preferable place to visit in lansdowne

title: Small lake/pond with boating..
review: I felt this place is more of hype and we went on a Wednesday and boating was closed. The entry to this place was also under repair and one has to walk around 0.5 kms (climb) to reach the attraction.  Kids might enjoy boating.

title: Artificial lake
review: Artificial lake but still the boating is enjoyable. There are swings for the kids too. There is an entry ticket of inr 20 and INR 80 without and with boating respectively. The lake has ducks and there are lots of rabbits and pigeons too. Good place for smaller kids.

title: Small Artificial relaxing space
review: A small bit of climbing would a problem for seniors else it a good walk to reach this spot from the parking place.

title: Small Man made lake
review: The lake is constructed & maintained by army. The entrance is Rs. 20 and for Boating there is a nominal charge. The lake is surrounded by trees. They are expanding it...saw a waterfall in the making. There is a canteen at the entrance. It is easily accessible by road.

title: Decent place .
review: Best part about this place is its not very crowded. Decent lake.Cafe is good .Paneer pakoras are yummy.

title: Good place but poorly managed.
review: Nice place to visit with kids, has small enclosure for rabbits and pigeons.

title: quite place, small lake, relaxing place to be visited with Family
review: I was a first timer at Lansdowne along with my family and relatives. Bhulla tal is one of the must see attractions in the afternoon and boating is a must here. There nominal fee per head at the entry and boating options are limited due to small size of lake. Lake has ducks and on the way to lake, there are couple of bird hives and rabbits also kept in cages for the visitors to keep engaged.

title: If u like boating?
review: This is located around 2-3 Km from Market and have a entry of 20 bucks and 80 for boating. Lake is small and u can click some photos, other than there is nothing special about it.

title: Time to Boat
review: Its fun if you go out with family or friends for boating. You can boat here for quite a time and move around to see the place they have some rabbits and pigeon too. Its green and relaxing place for a break from day to day life.

title: Good experience
review: If you are coming to Lansdowne, do visit this place. Good for youths, families, couples. It's nothing like thrilling or adventurous, but it's kind of chilling out place. You get to see a lake(not so big), you can do boating if you want, get to see ducks and swans floating right next to you if you are boating. They have a semi open restaurant at that place. Really cheap and tasty food. Go and try their Golgappa! They are surprisingly different ;) And you will find some extra things which are good for passing your time. I found it amazingly relaxing and I will definitely visit Lansdowne again when I get sick of office life :)

title: Nice place in otherwise no so happening location
review: We came to Lansdown for a family trip and it's nice to be in secluded and silent place for sometime

title: Kinda small pond
review: Enjoy the beauty of lansdowne and relax... if you miss it it wont be a big deal. Lansdowne is all about relaxing and enjoying nature... so enjoy

title: Small lake just for boating
review: Lansdowne is less popular hill station in north India and an excellent place if you are peace lover. Just relax and enjoy the natural beauty. Bhulla lake is a small lake and you can spend good time boating here. This is man-made lake and has nothing special. Just boat and enjoy the natural surrounding beauties.

title: Nothing great
review: Nothing great, just a very small lake with boating option available. Young kids will enjoy.If you have been to Nainital, Saattal etc, can skip this

title: Ducks on lake
review: If one love boating with Ducks then you will definitely enjoy the trip moreover dozen of Rabbits are also available to cheer with.

title: Good for children
review: Children can enjoy boating and can really spent good time......... though the food available is not upto the mark...

title: The food!!
review: You can have mostly all types of snacks vegetarian and non-vegetarian here including chocolates and ice creams.

title: Nice Place to Hangout...
review: Bhulla Tal is a nice place to hang out in Lansdowne. One can enjoy Boating in the small but clean tal along with ducks. When we visited one side of the tal was under re-construction. Just outside Tal one can njoy various snacks as well...!!!

title: Bhulla lake
review: It is a very small lake and looks like a village pond in India. Paddle  Boating at Rs 50 per person for fifteen minutes including entrance fee is available. However, it is a nice hangout place. People looking for a real nice big lake will be disappointed. There is a restaurant outside the entrance gate and one can have tea and snacks.

title: A greattrek
review: The place is amid mountains & is worth visit. Totally controlled by Military personnel very lively place....

title: Just like any other Lake.
review: Nothing special here. A simple and small Lake with boating option available. you can pass time by sitting lake-side and enjoying the weather.

title: Trip
review: Its an average place. Good for boating n all. Entry charges of 20rs which is not worth if boating is not your choice.

title: Bhulla Taal ...simple and good
review: I would say ...its OK...boating part is good but nothing adventurous...if you have some extra time to pass , you can vist it but not more than once..

title: Perfect Picnic Spot
review: Bhulla Tal Lake is a Perfect Picnic Spot for childrens, families. We did boating in lake and have a breakfast in Cafe shop. A small bridge over lake is perfect for photoshot. I love this place.

title: average plcae to while away time
review: if you dont have anythng to do n lansdowne you can visit this place, food is avaialble at very affordable rates at this lace..you can see ducks swimming with you

title: Good place to click pictures :)
review: You doesn't have much to do over there except clicking pictures on good locations :)

title: Very nice
review: This is beautiful small lake where u can enjoy boating also. You can watch birds, rabbit in the Garden and can take beautiful photos

title: Visit if you have nothing better to do
review: It's just a little lake , you can do boating though there is nothing intresting to look forward to .

title: peaceful
review: not much to do. just boating and peaceful views of nature. boating is not worth. theres a cafe nearby with lake view which has good snacks and one can enjoy lake from there

title: Nice place
review: Luvly place, good ambience, peaceful and charming, well maintained. Fully managed by Gorkha rifles military people.

title: Place for family & couples
review: small lake in the middle of the hill station,best for couples & family as it is not much crowded, only place you can spend time in lansdown other than the tiffin top point

title: good place to spend valuable time
review: really nice place to spend best time at this lake though artificially form by army but nice attraction for visitors . very calm place to be there .

title: Good picnic spot.
review: Good picnic spot. Good place for children to have fun. There are swings and sliders and one can enjoy boating as well.

title: Nice scenic beuty
review: Its a good spot if you are visiting lansdowne. Its a natural beautiful lake. Boating facility is there. It has an emporium to purchase souvenirs and a restaurant to have a bite. Overall a pleasant place to visit.

title: clean well kept lake, mnonitored by staff while you are boating
review: it's a nice family time out area with games, boating & ducks around.A restaurant is also there. Also a rabbit enclosure is kept there for kids.

title: good scenery-nice for picnic
review: we were here for a day long picnic with young children.the place is a big draw for children who enjoy boating in the lake and play with caged animals.

title: A good place to visit
review: The lake is really well maintained and and has a lot of other attractions like there is a park, they have some pet animals like rabbits, some birds, ginny pig, etc. You can get good food but it gets very crowded in the time between noon and late evening. It is best to visit till 11 am in the morning.

title: Slightly bigger than a village pond, but cleaner!
review: Since there is nothing much to do in Lansdowne, we went to this 'lake'. It is basically a water body created by a small dam/wall on one end.

title: Small lake...can be maintained more
review: Thanks to Garwhal Regiment for taking care of the lake. Though the lake is small but still you can enjoy boating...i will recommend it for family

title: One of the few places to experience in Lansdowne
review: The friendly ducks, green lake surrounded my mountains, efficient management, functioning life jackets, multiple boats and bright sun make it a good experience for visitors. The cafe in the vicinity offers good snacking options. Must see when in Lansdowne. Suitable for all age groups, however, families with children will enjoy this place more than others.

title: Best Attraction
review: A small man made lake which is maintained by the Army. There is a nominal entry fee to help maintain the area. Boat rides are available. Well kept surroundings. There is a small restaurant serving refreshments.

title: Jade Waters and Azure Sky - Number One at Lansdowne
review: Years ago it may not have been there on the Lansdowne scene but today this man-made lake is number one attraction at Lansdowne, or so I feel. Complete with a nearby canteen, a souvenir shop, a small park for children and a free parking; this place can make you spend few hours amid green surroundings without any complaints.

title: Nice Place to visit !!!
review: Its almost 1-2 km far from Lansdowne main market, its maintained by Army. This place has one lake where you can do boating.

title: Best place in Lansdowne
review: I found this place better than other sight seeing places in Lansdowne . We did boating . That was good. 50rs for 20min boating. Lake is very small. But it is surrounded by good landscape, so you must visit this place if you are coming to Lansdowne .

title: Boating is the main attraction here..
review: Bhulla Tal is a small lake where you can do boating. There are swans in the water and caged rabbits which just add character to this place

title: Boating at Bhulla Tal
review: Lansdowne is Eco-tourism place and this lake is quite a surprise. Located near the main market place surrounded by pine trees, well developed lake with nice peddle boating that you can enjoy for about 30 mins. Do not miss the open air snack bar to have a nice cup of tea.

title: Serene Pond
review: It is small lake in Lansdowne. It hosts white pigeons and rabbits. You can do boating in the lake. Eatery outside the lake serves everything you like.

title: Great beauty to access
review: Excellent place for boating lovers in lansdowne and having view of nature and beauty with some good food to eat outside the lake

title: Good place
review: Nice visit for an hour and also dont forget the boating. Also there is a very good restaurant just next to it.

title: Nice
review: Not a big lake..but nice to enjoy if travelling with kids !! There were little fishes in lake as well.A small park can attract the children.

title: Ideal for families with children
review: Nothing great. Ideal for families wanting to go on a boat ride with their children. Have seen better lakes in the past

title: Not worth the drive
review: With only one shop at the lake it's crazy if you reach there during meal time....Small lake and not worth a drive....only 30 mins worth spending

title: Very beautifully maintained
review: Beautiful lake and its surroundings; full marks again to Indian Army for maintaining the place and keeping it so clean. There is a small eatery and a souvenir shop also

title: Boating in Bhulla Lake
review: It is a very small lake and you can spend some time boating while roaming around in Lansdowne.It is maintained n run by Garwal Regiment so water in the lake and the boats are in very good condition. You will definitely enjoy.

title: peaceful place
review: if u want peace den lansdowne is must visit place nd dis lake is olso very gud and clean and peaceful environment

title: Very beautiful manmade lake
review: This lake is manmade lake but this lake is small and beautiful. The best part of this lake is made by the jawans or bhullas of gargwal rifles . This lake is known for boating  and there is a small canteen in bhulla tal

title: Nice peaceful pace
review: Good for families with young kids. Lake is good. Boating was fun too. Definitely recommend everyone going.

title: Overrated !!
review: Average place. Great for family with young kids visit. U can go boating. But not anything like Nainital .

title: Nice One
review: I Guess this place is managed by Army Personnel and very manitained. A lake, Rabbits, swans, pigeons (masakali types)

title: Nice place
review: Nice and calm place to relax. The whole area has been beautifully built. You can ducks, small bridge to cross the bridge, ample area for kids to enjoy themselves.

title: Depressing small lake, nothing much to enjoy
review: A very small lake located at some height. Directions to reach the lake are very poor. Small and just one parking lot for cars and mini buses. faced a total chaos in the parking lot. After parking the car you will have to walk uphill for some 700 m to discover a small lake with a few boats here and there. Although the park is well maintained. Nothing much for romantic travelers. Good for people travelling with kids.

title: Little lake for boating
review: This is the only lake available in lensdown you can do boating over there with safety outfits and 2-3 men's always taking care of you at the lake side little zoo also available I believe for children's.

title: Nice place...
review: It was fun to visit lake. Had boating and kids enjoyed.

title: do visit for boating and children's park
review: A must visit place for couples and with children. There is a park where children can enjoy. Boating is also available and you have a cafeteria for meals. must visit this place

title: amazing place
review: This is a beautiful place in lansdowne. u can easily spend 2-3 hours here . There u do lots of things like boating , child can play in children park , shopping n a good restaurant to eat food .

title: Just averge
review: The lake is just an average lake nothing new but the only good thing here was if u are lucky and weather is beautiful then u might experience blissful views and find yourself surrounded by clouds , but that's true for any place in lansdowne,

title: Dont forget to visit this place..
review: It is an artificial lake, nicely maintained by Army.I would recommend visitors to visit this place during monsoon.

title: Peaceful lake
review: Lake is quiet and relaxing.

title: Nice Place
review: A small lake to help facilitate the travelers with the joy and experience of boating between the hills

title: Bhulla Tal Lake
review: Nice little lake tucked away in Landsdowne. We missed it the first time and had to go back to find it. Neatly kept with plenty of opportunities for children to play etc. Boating facilities are also available with a bridge across the lake mostly used for taking selfies!! There is a reasonable restaurant nearby-which seems to be very popular and hence very crowded.

title: Nice place n Serene beauty
review: Small boating area but very well maintained by army. There is a small restaurant around. Beauty of Lansdowne is in its scenic offerings & hence don't expect nainitaal like lake here

title: A good picnic spot
review: A small but very clean lake.place is very well managed.paddle boats available.A small eatery is there with elaborate variety.

title: Man-made lake which is not so great
review: An artificial lake, with entry fees of Rs.10/person and pedal boating @Rs.50/person.  Nothing much to write home about.  There is a photo booth which will print your photos on to coffee mugs for Rs. 250/-. Lots of chairs to sit and relax.  Not much view though.

title: Nature walk in Landsdowne
review: The boating and duck watch are interesting otherwise there is not much to do in Landsdowne. Do go trekking on mountains around the lake

title: good place in landsdowne
review: one can go and do the boating there, if weather is good and can have a great tym, eating and watching ducks and goose.

title: go place to go...
review: Nice Place for childrens, they will enjoy the boating in a small lake and would love to have ice creams in the park

title: Nice Place to hangout with kids
